action.action-desc: Mr. Lawson of Florida introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To amend the Fair Credit Reporting Act to permit certain credit repair organizations to dispute credit information directly with a furnisher, and for other purposes.

section.header: Ability of certain credit repair organizations to dispute information directly with a furnisher
section.text: Section 623(a)(8) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act (15 U.S.C. 1681s–2(a)(8)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in the paragraph heading, by striking consumer and inserting consumer and credit repair organization;
in subparagraph (A), by striking consumer. and inserting consumer or credit repair organization.;

subparagraph.text: in clause (ii), by adding and at the end;

clause.text: by striking consumer and inserting consumer or the credit repair organization; and
by striking ; and and inserting a period; and

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (D), by striking consumer and inserting consumer or credit repair organization;

subparagraph.text: in the matter preceding clause (i), by striking from a consumer and inserting from a consumer or credit repair organization;
in clause (ii), by striking consumer and inserting consumer or credit repair organization; and
in clause (iii), by striking to the consumer and inserting to the consumer or credit repair organization that submitted the notice;

clause.text: in the matter preceding subclause (I), by striking consumer and inserting consumer or credit repair organization;
in subclause (I), by striking consumer and inserting consumer or credit repair organization; and
in subclause (II), by striking by a consumer and inserting by a consumer or credit repair organization; and
by striking notify the consumer and inserting notify the consumer or credit repair organization that submitted the dispute notice; and
by striking by the consumer and inserting by the consumer or credit repair organization; and

paragraph.text: by amending subparagraph (G) to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: For purposes of this paragraph, the term credit repair organization means an entity authorized to act on behalf of a consumer that—

clause.text: is a credit repair organization, as defined in section 403(3); or
but for section 403(3)(B)(i), would be such a credit repair organization.
